items.title: Best Chicken Chow Mein Recipe
items.description: This is the Bald Chef's best recipe for Chinese Chicken Chow Mein. I will show you step by step how to cook this classic Cantonese dish. This a very authentic recipe much like you would find in a Restaurant southern One of my first experiences eating Chinese Food was in the 1950's and 60's. There was not much in the way of verity in the few local Chinese Restaurants.

items.title: Shrimp Fried Rice - Chinese Shrimp Fried Rice
items.description: Sometimes, you just want to make a easy (but also delicious) meal. Sometimes, you may have extra rice (fresh and cooled rice or leftover rice). Sometimes, you may have extra rice, eggs, frozen peas, and frozen shrimp. How convenient! You can make shrimp fried rice with it all! The rest of the flavoring is optional (onions, garlic, etc). I always have eggs in my fridge, and I like to keep frozen peas and frozen shrimp on hand for times when I can just make shrimp fried rice!

items.title: How to make Singapore Prawn Noodles Soup
items.description:
This dish is a hawker centre favourite! And it's so easy to do. All you need is to get the stock right.
It's usually served with fresh egg noodles or rice vermicelli (or a mixture of both), boiled prawns, fried fishcake and bean sprouts. Some people eat the tails/ribs too.

items.title: Dashi-maki Tamago (Rolled Omelet)
items.description:
Japanese basic side dish is tamagoyaki (omelet). The soft and refined "dashi-maki-tamago" is good for Obento or serving to guests. This time we show the way to make a soft-boiled dashi-maki-tamago 
with cling film. So you can make it without failing.If you learn how to make it, you can change your table more colorful

items.title: Mole de olla
items.description:
Ingredients: For 6 servings
4 pieces of shank cross cut or 2 lb (900 g) chuck steak
1 onion
2 garlic cloves
1 bunch of epazote or cilantro
5 guajillo chiles or california
3 corn in the cob

items.title: Chicken SiuMai (Shumai) - Steamed Dim Sum Dumpling Recipe
items.description: Siumai (Cantonese) or shumai (Mandarin) is one of the popular dim sum items found in Chinese restaurants. It is usually made with pork and/or shrimp. The challenge is making this mouth watering bundle of yummy healthier yet still contain the goodness. Chicken is the secret ingredient! Surprised? Probably not :). And don't worry, its deliciousness won't be compromised! BTW, this recipe is also kid tested and approved so *two thumbs up*!

items.title: Camping Cooking Tips
items.description: When considering cooking on a camping trip, it's important to remember that block ice is better than ice cubes, and that cooking over an open fire is best achieved through hot coals and not open flames. Learn about tinfoil as a great cooking tool on camping trips with help from a recreational kayaking instructor and outdoor adventurer in this free video on campfire cooking.

items.title: Caribbean Green Seasoning
items.description: How to make the Caribbean style green seasoning paste that's used in all meat, fish and vegetable dishes in the Caribbean. A rich and lovely sort of marinade using fresh herbs and spiced up with ginger and pimento peppers. This green seasoning is from a recipe from Trinidad and Tobago but you can versions of it one just about every island in the Caribbean.

items.title: Potato Galette (classic French garnish) professional cooking recipe
items.description: While there are several different types of galettes, this is arguably the most finicky one to make, because there is no cheese or egg to hold it together. It is ONLY potato and butter, so you have to cook it slowly and carefully. It is especially suitable as a garnish underneath meat stews, such as Beef Bourguignon.

items.title: How to Make Mapo Tofu 麻婆豆腐の作り方
items.description:
Ingredients for Mapo Tofu
(serves 2)

1 tbsp Sesame Oil
100g Ground Pork (3.53 oz)
1 tbsp Chopped Garlic
1 tbsp Chopped Ginger
1/2 tbsp Doubanjiang - Chili Bean Paste
1 tbsp Tian Mian Jiang - Sweet Bean Sauce
1 tbsp Sake

- Chicken Stock -
1/2 tsp Granulated Chicken Stock (Chinese-style)
150 ml Hot Water (5.07 fl oz)

1 tbsp Soy Sauce
1 tbsp Sake
1 block of Firm Tofu (350g/12.3 oz)
30g Garlic Chives (1.06 oz)

2 tsp Potato Starch
1⅓ tbsp Water

Sichuan Pepper
Steamed Rice with Millet

** Doubanjiang, Tian Mian Jiang and Sichuan Pepper are found in the Chinese food section of most major grocery stores.

items.title: Consuming Passions Chips Recipe | Belgian Style
items.description:
How to cook chips:
There is no doubt that the world's best chips - or French Fries - are in fact made in Belgium, though the Dutch might dispute this. Chips, Belgian-style, are the first dish I learned to make at the age of 9 and to go with them I made a homemade mayonnaise which I used to call My Own 'Naise'. Because take-away and restaurant chips are so often disappointing I offer you this recipe for do-it-yourself Belgian-style fries, which 
are guaranteed to be superb.

items.title: Dukan Diet Chicken Soup Recipe
items.description: After 4 months on the Dr Dukan diet program the "Attack phase" of all protein can get boring so I have created some recipes to make that week a real treat. This is a recipe for Creamy Chicken soup that can be made with any leftover meat - chicken, beef, and even ground meats. I hope to get my other favorites online to share with you. Enjoy and bon appetite!

items.title: How to Cook with Herbs
items.description: Cooking with herbs can add a burst of flavor to your dishes, if you know how to use them properly. Here are some tips for cooking with herbs.
